definitions.definition: The action of entering, or going in.
definitions.example: Her entrance attracted no attention whatsoever.

definitions.definition: The act of taking possession, as of property, or of office.
definitions.example: the entrance of an heir upon his inheritance, or of a magistrate into office

definitions.definition: The place of entering, as a gate or doorway.
definitions.example: Place your bag by the entrance so that you can find it easily.
You'll need a ticket to gain entrance to the museum.

definitions.definition: The entering upon; the beginning, or that with which the beginning is made; the commencement; initiation.
The causing to be entered upon a register, as a ship or goods, at a customhouse; an entering.
definitions.example: His entrance of the arrival was made the same day.

definitions.definition: The angle which the bow of a vessel makes with the water at the water line.
The bow, or entire wedgelike forepart of a vessel, below the water line.
When a musician starts playing or singing, entry.
To delight and fill with wonder.
definitions.example: The children were immediately entranced by all the balloons.
